subtitle: it is said that eni the water God
engineered the blackheaded people of
modern-day India and Africa who are
considered the closest ancestors to the
samans alongside the
Ethiopians as the village of arido grew
so did the temple by 4,500 BC the temple
stood on a platform about a meter high
and continued to expand over the
centuries into a zigurat a step-like
pyramid prosperous towns like eridu
attracted Travelers and Merchants who
visited its temples such as those
dedicated to eni to make offerings they
brought items from their own villages to
donate or trade for local Goods like
Barley Sheep or eridu distinctive
Pottery an example of international
trade in eridu was copper copper a
valuable metal not found in southern
Mesopotamia had to be imported from
places like modern Oman or turkey
remarkably ubide period artisans in IDU
were already forging
